net.jxta.impl.content
Class AbstractContentTransfer

java.lang.Object
  net.jxta.impl.content.AbstractContentTransfer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContentTransfer
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultContentTransfer, SRDISocketContentTransfer
public abstract class AbstractContentTransfer
extends Object
implements ContentTransfer

Abstract implementation of a ContentProvider, providing the basic infrastructure for locating the desired quantity of remote advertisements, notifying listeners of location state changes, and basic infrastrucure around transfer attempts. This class is by no means required to be extended to implement a ContentTransfer but simply attempts to consolidate much of the logic that would be repeated throughout many implementations.

startSourceLocation

public void startSourceLocation()
Recommend or prompt the implementation to begin the process of locating remote data sources. This process is allowed to take place independently of the transfer itself and can be used to help select a specific transfer implementation to use when used in a transfer aggregation. As the source location process implementation is entirely dependent on the transfer implementation this method is treated as an advisory and is not required to be called prior to calling startTransfer.

Specified by:
startSourceLocation in interface ContentTransfer

stopSourceLocation

public void stopSourceLocation()
Recommend or prompt the implementation to cease the process of locating remote data sources. As the source location process implementation is entirely dependent on the transfer implementation and as the cost of source location may vary widely from provider to provider, this method is treated as advisory and is not required to be called prior to or after calling startTransfer.

Specified by:
stopSourceLocation in interface ContentTransfer

getSourceLocationState

public ContentSourceLocationState getSourceLocationState()
Returns the current state of this transfer's remote source location activities.

Specified by:
getSourceLocationState in interface ContentTransfer
Returns:
current source location state

startTransfer

public void startTransfer(File destination)
Begins the process of finding and retrieving the Content, storing the results into the File location specified on as as-needed basis, overwriting any pre-existing data at this location. The state of the contents of the file path provided are to be considered by the end-user to be undefined until the completion of the transfer. At transfer completion, the file should only exist if the transfer was successful and only if the ContentProvided needed to use the file location to store data. Some transfer implementations may opt to not use the file location provided, in which case the ContentProvider should ensure that the file is deleted.

Specified by:
startTransfer in interface ContentTransfer
Parameters:
destination - file location to write the resulting data into

getTransferState

public ContentTransferState getTransferState()
Returns the current data transfer state.

Specified by:
getTransferState in interface ContentTransfer
Returns:
current transfer state

cancel

public void cancel()
Cancels all remote data source location and Content transfer activity, if still in progress. After a transfer has been cancelled it can no longer be used to locate sources or retrieve data. If a transfer has reached a terminal state (i.e., transferState.isFinished() returns true) then this method should have no effect.

Specified by:
cancel in interface ContentTransfer

waitFor

public void waitFor()
             throws InterruptedException,
                    TransferException
Wait for the completion of the transfer.

Specified by:
waitFor in interface ContentTransfer
Throws:
InterruptedException - when the thread is interrupted.
TransferException - if there is an unrecoverable problem during the transfer
TransferCancelledException - if the cancel method is called or if the ContentProvider is shut down prior to transfer completion

waitFor

public void waitFor(long timeout)
             throws InterruptedException,
                    TransferException
Wait for the completion of the transfer for a maximum of timeout milliseconds. If the timeout expires, the method will return without raising an exception.

Specified by:
waitFor in interface ContentTransfer
Parameters:
timeout - maximum amount of time to wait, in milliseconds
Throws:
InterruptedException - when the thread is interrupted.
TransferException - if there is an unrecoverable problem during the transfer
TransferCancelledException - if the cancel method is called or if the ContentProvider is shut down prior to transfer completion

setContent

protected void setContent(Content finalContent)
Sets the resulting Content object. This method should be called as during a transferAttempt implementation execution run, prior to that execution run returning ContentTransferState.COMPLETED.

Parameters:
finalContent - successfully retrieved content instance

getContentTransferListeners

protected List<ContentTransferListener> getContentTransferListeners()
Gets the list of ContentTransferListeners associated with this transfer instance. This list is safe to iterate over and modify, as it is backed by a copy-on-write implementation.

Returns:
list of ContentTransferListeners

setSourceLocationInterval

protected void setSourceLocationInterval(int newInterval)
Sets the source location interval that will be used when scheduling new discovery requests when attempting to locate more source locations.

Parameters:
newInterval - new source location interval, in seconds

setDiscoveryThreshold

protected void setDiscoveryThreshold(int newThreshold)
Sets the discovery threshold used to limit the number of responses that will be returned by the discovery service when attempting to locate more data allSources.

Parameters:
newThreshold - the new maximum number of discovery responses to request from the discovery service

setLocalDiscoveryEnabled

protected void setLocalDiscoveryEnabled(boolean enabled)
Sets the flag indicating whether or not local advertisements will be search for when attempting to locate new source locations. This is primarily intended for debug and is safe to leave enabled.

Parameters:
enabled - true to search local advertisements, false to not

setRemoteDiscoveryEnabled

protected void setRemoteDiscoveryEnabled(boolean enabled)
Sets the flag indicating whether or not remote advertisements will be search for when attempting to locate new source locations. This is primarily intended for debug and is safe to leave enabled.

Parameters:
enabled - true to search remote advertisements, false to not

getEnoughLocationCount

protected abstract int getEnoughLocationCount()
Gets the number of source location advertisements that must be obtained before attempting to start a transfer. Typically, this will be a small number, even 1.

Returns:
number of advertisements to discover before transfer will be attempted

getManyLocationCount

protected abstract int getManyLocationCount()
Gets the number of source location advertisements that must be obtained before source location will be shut down. This should represent some happy medium between having too few allSources to be efficient and having too many allSources to practically use.

Returns:
number of advertisements to discover before source location will be stopped

isAdvertisementOfUse

protected abstract boolean isAdvertisementOfUse(ContentShareAdvertisement adv)
Determines whether or not the advertisement provided is of use to the provider. Advertisements not of use are not counted toward the provider's "enough" and "many" thresholds.

Parameters:
adv - advertisement to test
Returns:
true if advertisment is of use, false otherwise

transferAttempt

protected abstract ContentTransferState transferAttempt(File dest,
                                                        List<ContentShareAdvertisement> sources,
                                                        List<ContentShareAdvertisement> newSources)
                                                 throws TransferException
Attempt to transfer the content from the allSources provided, using the specified destination file for data storage.

Parameters:
dest - destination file which should be used to store the content data
sources - all currently known sources
newSources - all sources which have been discovered since the last transfer attempt
Returns:
content transfer state best representing the results of this attempt. Must be set to ContentState.COMPLETED on success, in which case the implementation must have called setContent().
Throws:
TransferFailedException - when the transfer has irrecoverably failed. No more transfer attempts will be made and the failure will be propagated to the user.
TransferException - when the transfer has failed and it is likely that a retry (either now or in the near future) will have better success.
